p.s: Description of Afipia birgiae sp. nov.

Afipia birgiae (bir'gi.ae. N.L. fem. gen. n. birgiae of Birg, in honour of Marie-Laure Birg, a technician, for her many contributions to the isolation of strict intracellular bacteria, especially Tropheryma whipplei)
Exhibits all of the characteristics of the genus, does not grow at 35Â°C or on Columbia agar with 5% sheep blood and is not motile.
Grows in co-culture with Acanthamoeba polyphaga in Page's amoebal saline.

Isolated from the water supply of the La Timone Hospital Centre (Marseilles, France).
